newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore's electronic index soars 2.79 percent.
newsitem.headline: Singapore's electronic index soars 2.79 percent.

text.p: The Stock Exchange of Singapore's key electronic index soared 2.79 percent to 89.31 in early Tuesday trade on the back of a strong U.S. electronic stock performance, dealers said.
On Monday, Nasdaq set a record high, led by electronic stocks like Microsoft Corp and Intel Corp.
Dealers said Singapore electronic stocks were also cheered by a strong November semiconductor book to bill ratio.
The U.S. Semiconductor Industry Association on Monday reported its key industry indicator rose in November to the highest level since October 1995.

The November book to bill ratio rose to 1.15 in November from a revised 1.11 in October, beating consensus forecasts that the index would be flat or slightly firmer than October. The ratio means manufacturers received US$115 in new orders last month for every US$100 in shipments.
In Singapore, the electronic index was mainly boosted by Creative Technology, which extended overnight gains to Singapore $13.50, up S$1.30 on 154,800 lots.
Other electronic stocks were generally firm.
